channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 4 GOP Senators join Democrats to rebuke Trump on tariffs for a third time this week
item.description: A handful of Republicans joined Democrats to vote against President Trump's emergency tariffs against Brazil, Canada and other countries. But the vote...

item.title: Trial set over NPR allegations that CPB yielded to White House pressure
item.description: NPR alleges that CPB unlawfully yanked away a planned three-year contract worth $36 million in the face of intense pressure from the White House to se...

item.title: A judge is set to decide whether SNAP benefits can be cut off on Saturday
item.description: A Boston federal judge suggested she was not persuaded by the Trump administration's argument that it is legally barred from using a USDA emergency fu...

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of his titles and evicts him from the Royal Lodge
item.description: Buckingham Palace said the king's brother will be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor and not as a prince, and he will move from his Royal Lodge resid...

item.title: Trump administration sets lowest-ever cap on refugee admissions to U.S.
item.description: The lowest cap on refugees since the program was established in 1980 comes as the U.S. prioritizes resettling Afrikaners from South Africa.

item.title: Storm reveals artifacts preserved in Quinhagak permafrost
Trump caps refugee admissions at record low - with most to be white South Africans
item.description: The president sets the limit at 7,500 for the coming year, a dramatic cut from 125,000.

item.title: Sudan RSF chief promises investigation as anger mounts over el-Fasher killings
item.description: The announcement comes after growing reports of mass killings, including of patients at a hospital.

item.title: Trump hails 'amazing' meeting with China's Xi but no formal trade deal agreed
item.description: The US president and his Chinese counterpart met face-to-face for the first time in six years.

item.title: Prince Andrew loses royal titles, Royal Lodge lease
item.description: Prince Andrew is being stripped of his royal titles and must move out of his mansion, Buckingham Palace announced on Thursday. Andrew has come under i...

item.title: Mortgage rates are the lowest they've been since 2022. Here's how to get one even lower now.
item.description: Mortgage interest rates are the lowest they've been since 2022, but there are multiple ways to get one even lower.

item.title: Prince Andrew stripped of titles and must surrender lease to Windsor mansion
item.description: Prince Andrew is being stripped of his titles and must surrender his lease to Royal Lodge, according to a statement from Buckingham Palace.

item.title: How Americans feel about changing the clocks, according to a new AP-NORC poll
At what age can you no longer buy life insurance? What seniors should know
item.description: You can typically buy life insurance well into your senior years, but your options and costs will change with age.

item.title: 'The bodies just kept coming' - photographer at deadly Rio police raid
item.description: A witness says residents brought down body after body - some mutilated - after the massive police raid which has left at least 120 dead.

item.title: The 2025 U.S government shutdown, by the numbers
item.description: The 2025 federal government shutdown, in the first year of Trump's second term, is one of the longest in U.S. history.

item.title: Russian activity increasing around key Ukrainian town, army chief says
item.description: The capture of Pokrovsk could unlock Russian efforts to seize the rest of the Donetsk region.

item.title: Teacher who was shot by 6-year-old student at school testifies she thought she had died
item.description: A former Virginia teacher who was shot by a 6-year-old student in 2023 says she thought she died that day.
